audiobook.description:
Author(s): Nathaniel Hawthorne Narrator(s): Michael Learned

Written in the winter of 1849, The Scarlet Letter unfolds the story of Hester Prynne, a young woman branded as an adulteress in the harsh Puritan world of seventeenth-century New England. As Hester calls on her inner strength to transcend her shame, the scarlet letter ceases to be a stigma and finally becomes Hester's symbol of self-affirmation.

This dramatic reading heightens the sense of lyric poetry that permeates every line of Nathaniel Hawthorne's great novel.
audiobook.html_description:
Author(s): Nathaniel Hawthorne
Narrator(s): Michael Learned
<p>Written in the winter of 1849, <i>The Scarlet Letter</i> unfolds the story of Hester Prynne, a young woman branded as an adulteress in the harsh Puritan world of seventeenth-century New England. As Hester calls on her inner strength to transcend her shame, the scarlet letter ceases to be a stigma and finally becomes Hester's symbol of self-affirmation. </P><P>This dramatic reading heightens the sense of lyric poetry that permeates every line of Nathaniel Hawthorne's great novel. </p>
audiobook.name: The Scarlet Letter
